However, I can provide some general information about Shone's latest album and their background. Shone is actually a musical project by American artist and songwriter, Chris LeMasters who is also known for his work in the band, As Cities Burn. 

Shone's latest album, "Heat Thing" was released in 2020 and features a blend of electronic, indie, and experimental music. While I don't have access to the specific lyrical content of the album, it's been reported that the songs on "Heat Thing" were inspired by LeMasters' childhood experiences growing up in the American South. 

According to an interview with All Things Loud, LeMasters described how the album was "born from the depths of his psyche" and explored themes of rebirth, transformation, and the intersection of technology and nature. He also spoke about how his childhood experiences in the Southern United States influenced his songwriting, particularly when it came to reflecting on the dark parts of his upbringing.

It's likely that the lyrical themes present in "Heat Thing" reflect Chris LeMasters' personal experiences and reflect his desire to explore and process these experiences through his music.
